title.narrative: Strengthening the capacity of Latin American CSOs to promote economic and social justice

description.narrative:
The aim of this project is to consolidate a space for the discussion of fiscal (i.e. economic and social) justice in Latin America by strengthening the capacity of civil society organisations (CSOs), rights holders and activists to mobilise critical masses across society and to successfully influence political authorities. This will be achieved with the help of Latindadd's region-wide network of grassroots organisations, advocacy groups and experts in the field, and attention will be paid to cross-cutting issues such as gender equality and human rights.
Specifically, the focus of the project is on strengthening the capacities of CSOs and activists working on economic and social justice across Latin America to help them build strategic alliances with relevant stakeholders, show solidarity with rights holders, raise emblematic cases of fiscal (in-)justice, apply innovative communications strategies and develop political analyses as well as proposals for socio-economic change. The project will be implemented in Brazil, Buenos Aires, Ecuador, El Salvador, Colombia, Guatemala, Mexico, Nicaragua, Paraguay and Peru.
Latindadd is the Latin American Network for Economic and Social Justice. It grew out of CEAS, a longstanding partner of CAFOD working on debt reduction, and of the Andean and Central American Strategic Network on Debt and Poverty, which brought together several specialist organisations working on these issues and were particularly active around the Jubilee 2000 campaign for debt cancellation. Previously coordinated by Forum Solidaridad Peru, since the beginning of 2019, Latindadd is a separate legal entity, based in Lima, Peru.
